name: Scientific Internships at Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA)
description: The Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA) offers year-round scientific internships for students pursuing or holding a bachelor's or master’s degree in natural or computer sciences, mathematics, or related disciplines. Interns can work with research groups for up to one year and gain hands-on experience in scientific research. Applications are accepted continuously, and students must contact a research group leader directly with their CV and motivation. The program provides an official employment contract and a minimum monthly gross salary of €1,523.
host: Institute of Science and Technology Austria
majors: Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Internship Programme 2026 in France
description: The OECD Internship Programme offers 500 internship positions to motivated students from all countries who are enrolled in undergraduate, master’s, or doctoral programs. The internship takes place mainly in Paris, France, and lasts for 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 12 months. Selected interns gain practical experience in economics, policy, and international development under the guidance of OECD staff. Each intern receives a monthly allowance of €1,000 and visa assistance. The program accepts applications year-round, providing a gateway into one of the world’s leading policy institutions.
host: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
majors: Economics, Political Science and International Relations, Sociology
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: KAUST Microelectronics Winter Camp (MEWC) 2026 in Saudi Arabia
description: The KAUST MEWC Winter Camp is a 6-week research-based program designed for global students to explore microelectronics and applied technologies. Participants engage in lectures, workshops, and laboratory work at one of the most advanced research campuses in the Middle East. KAUST provides financial coverage for travel, accommodation, and visa assistance. The program gives access to world-class research facilities and mentorship. It offers a unique opportunity to experience scientific innovation in an international setting.
host: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST)
majors: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Physics, Chemical and Materials Engineering
eligibility: UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: Youth Future Summit Centre for International Peace Studies (CIPS) 2026 in Switzerland
description: The Youth Future Summit organized by CIPS gathers young leaders from over 120 countries in Geneva to address global challenges such as climate change, AI, and sustainable development. Participants engage in discussions, workshops, and visits to major institutions including the UN and CERN. The fully funded program includes flights, accommodation, meals, and local transportation. It serves as a global networking platform for changemakers. The summit will be held from 5–8 February 2026.
majors: Economics, Political Science and International Relations, Sociology, World Languages, Literature and Culture, Biology, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, Civil and Environmental Engineering
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Youth Global Forum Centre for Global Dialogue and Leadership (CGDL) 2026 in Spain
description: The Youth Global Forum 2026 unites activists and emerging leaders from around the world to discuss sustainable futures and global policy. Organized by the Centre for Global Dialogue and Leadership (CGDL), the forum aligns with EU youth frameworks. The four-day fully funded event in Madrid covers travel, accommodation, meals, and cultural exchange activities. Participants gain certification and access to leadership workshops. The forum runs from 15–18 January 2026.
host: Centre for Global Dialogue and Leadership (CGDL)
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Global Change Summit 2025 in Turkiye
description: The Global Change Summit 2025 brings together students, educators, and professionals to collaborate on sustainability, peacebuilding, and climate action. The event lasts four days, from 12–15 December 2025, featuring keynote lectures and interactive workshops. Fully funded benefits include flights, accommodation, meals, and visa support. Participants learn from global experts and build networks for positive change. It is a transformative experience fostering youth leadership in SDGs.
host: Organisation for Global Peace and Development (OGPD)
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Human Rights Summit 2026 in Canada
description: The Human Rights Summit 2026, held at the University of British Columbia, focuses on freedom of speech, equality, and education as the foundation of human rights. The four-day conference includes lectures, cultural visits, and award ceremonies. Partial and full funding options are available, covering airfare, meals, and accommodation. Participants from all disciplines are welcome. The summit takes place from 21–24 May 2026.
host: Vancouver Foundation for Research and Innovation (VFRI)
majors: Education, Economics, Political Science and International Relations, Sociology, History
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: UPG Sustainability Leadership Program 2026 in the USA
description: The UPG Sustainability Leadership Program is a one-week fully funded training program in Hurricane Island, Maine. It aims to equip participants with leadership skills for advancing the UN Sustainable Development Goals. The program includes workshops, networking events, and mentorship by global sustainability experts. All travel and participation costs are covered except visa fees. Participants receive official support letters for visa applications and form lasting professional networks
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Global Leadership Challenge (GLC) 2025
description: The GLC is a leadership development program co-hosted by the University of Oxford and the St. Gallen Symposium. It gathers 100 young leaders from around the world to explore responsible leadership through action-based projects. Participants receive mentorship, collaborate on global challenges, and gain an Oxford Character Project certificate. Top-performing teams are invited to the St. Gallen Symposium 2026. The program promotes cross-cultural learning and sustainable development leadership.
host: University of Oxford & St. Gallen Symposium
majors: Business Administration, Economics, Political Science and International Relations, Sociology, World Languages, Literature and Culture
eligibility: GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) Summer Research Program (SRP) 2026
description: The EPFL SRP offers 8 weeks of hands-on research in Lausanne, Switzerland. Participants work in life sciences, biophysics, bioinformatics, or related disciplines under faculty supervision. The program enhances laboratory experience, research methodology, and academic communication skills. Students also gain international exposure and networking opportunities at one of Europe’s top universities. It is fully immersive and highly competitive.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: World Leadership Forum (WLF) 2026
description: The WLF 2026 gathers youth leaders, policymakers, and professionals in Warsaw to address global issues such as climate action, AI, and governance. Organized by Nexus Public Policy Institute, it empowers participants through debates, training, and diplomatic networking. Attendees can apply for fully funded, partially funded, or self-funded participation. The forum encourages youth innovation, leadership, and sustainable policymaking. Online participation with digital certification is also available.
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Max Planck Computer Science Internship
description: The Max Planck Institutes for Informatics, Software Systems, and Security & Privacy offer fully funded research internships for outstanding students in Computer Science. Interns work on cutting-edge projects under the supervision of faculty mentors in Saarbrücken, Kaiserslautern, or Bochum. The program provides full financial support including housing, travel, and stipends. Internships typically last 12–14 weeks and can be extended. English is the working language, and knowledge of German is not required.
majors: Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: World Youth Forum 2026 in Portugal
description: The World Youth Forum 2026 in Porto, Portugal, gathers young leaders to discuss global issues like sustainability, innovation, and diplomacy. The 4-day forum includes workshops, networking, and leadership sessions to foster civic engagement and global cooperation. Scholarships are available - fully funded, partially funded, and free access options. The event aims to promote youth empowerment and intercultural dialogue. IELTS is not required; English proficiency is sufficient.
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: European Youth Summit 2026
description: The European Youth Summit 2026 brings together young visionaries, changemakers, and future leaders from across Europe and globe for four transformative days in Geneva, Switzerland. Join this premier international gathering designed to empower youth through diplomatic engagement, leadership development, and cross-cultural collaboration.
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Lunar and Planetary Institute (LPI) / NASA Summer Internship 2026
description: The Lunar and Planetary Institute offers a 10-week, fully funded summer internship in collaboration with NASA Johnson Space Center. Selected undergraduate students conduct research in planetary science under expert mentorship. Participants receive at least $13,351 to cover all living and travel expenses. The program helps students gain professional research experience and expand their scientific networks. IELTS/TOEFL is not required if an English proficiency certificate is provided by the university.
majors: Physics, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, Mathematics
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: European Southern Observatory (ESO) Science Communication Internship 2025
description: ESO offers a six-month onsite internship in its Communication Department in Garching, Germany. Interns will work on news articles, web content, videos, and exhibits, learning to communicate science for public audiences. The program includes monthly living allowance, accommodation, and return airfare. The work experience involves both internal and external communications in an international collaborative environment. Applicants must submit motivation letter, CV, and writing samples.
majors: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Computer Science, Sociology, World Languages, Literature and Culture
eligibility: All

name: GET_Involved ERASMUS+ Traineeship Programme
description: The GET_Involved programme under ERASMUS+ offers traineeships at FAIR/GSI for students and recent graduates. Trainees participate in structured international project environments, gaining technical and soft skills while working in science and engineering topics. The programme supports stay abroad with financial support for subsistence and travel; additional accommodation support possible depending on merit. Duration ranges from 3 to 12 months depending on project and agreement. Applicants undergo a multi-step process including application, matching with host department, and institutional confirmation.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: DAAD University Summer Courses in Germany for Foreign Students and Graduates
description: A fully funded German language summer program by DAAD for undergraduate and graduate students. Participants attend language and regional studies courses in Germany (June–September). The program covers tuition, accommodation, insurance, and travel allowance. Courses are taught exclusively in German and require in-person attendance. Applicants must have completed at least two years of university studies.
majors: World Languages, Literature and Culture, History
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: Fund for Peace Internship Program
description: A remote or part-time internship focused on conflict prevention, peacebuilding, and human rights. Interns conduct research, data analysis, and writing projects, gaining NGO experience in global security and development. The internship is flexible and can last 3–6 months. It offers a stipend ($350–700 per month) and may lead to professional opportunities. Open to undergraduate, graduate, and recent graduates worldwide.
majors: Political Science and International Relations, Sociology
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: MBZUAI Undergraduate Research Internship Program (UGRIP)
description: A fully funded 4-week summer AI research internship at the Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence in Abu Dhabi. Participants conduct supervised research in AI fields like NLP, ML, and CV. Benefits include airfare, visa, accommodation, stipend, and mentorship by top AI faculty. The program is highly competitive (4% acceptance rate). It is ideal for students seeking early research experience in AI.
host: Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI)
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Taiwan International Internship Program (TIIP)
description: A fully funded 2-month research internship hosted by Academia Sinica, Taiwan’s leading research institution. Participants choose three mentors and conduct laboratory work under professional supervision. The program covers accommodation, airfare, and monthly stipend. Interns present their findings through poster and oral presentations. Open to senior undergraduates and master's students worldwide.
majors: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science
eligibility: UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (OIST) Research Internship Program
description: A prestigious research internship at the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology, Japan. Interns work in cutting-edge laboratories under faculty mentorship for 3–6 months. The program provides airfare, accommodation, and stipend support. Participants gain hands-on experience across diverse STEM fields and exposure to graduate-level research. Ideal for students considering research careers or OIST PhD studies.
host: Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology
eligibility: UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: CUHK Summer Undergraduate Research Programme (SURP)
description: An 8-week research experience at the Chinese University of Hong Kong for international undergraduates. Students conduct supervised research projects under CUHK professors and earn academic credit. The program also includes orientation and cultural exchange activities. Accommodation is provided on campus, and all projects are conducted in English. Participants gain global research exposure and intercultural understanding.
host: The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK)
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Mayo Clinic SURF (Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship)
description: The Mayo Clinic SURF program allows undergraduate students to work in biomedical research labs under mentorship. Participants engage in project work, attend seminars, and present their findings. The program covers research training in a clinical research environment. It’s a competitive but accessible path for undergrads in life sciences and related fields. Offers strong credentialing and networking in health research.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: SAI Barcelona Internships Summer I 2026
description: An 8-week program in Barcelona offering internships in various fields: Finance, Communications, Design, Education, Hospitality etc. Designed to give international experience, build skills, work in multicultural professional environments. Applicants from various countries can apply; Spanish not required (but helps). Combines internship work + academic credits. Has standard requirements like personal statement, recommendations etc.
majors: Education, Economics, Political Science and International Relations, Sociology, World Languages, Literature and Culture
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year

name: CIEE Global Internship Program
description: The CIEE Global Internship Program offers students an eight-week international internship in cities worldwide, combining professional experience with academic coursework. Participants work full-time in their field of interest while earning 5–6 university credits and exploring the host city’s culture. CIEE collaborates individually with students to find placements tailored to their goals and major. The program includes accommodation, cultural activities, and scholarships of up to $5,000 for eligible students. Internships are unpaid but provide valuable global networking and skill-building opportunities.
host: CIEE (Council on International Educational Exchange) in collaboration with University of Kansas
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Yessenov Research Internships / Yessenov Foundation
description: Yessenov Foundation (Kazakhstan) runs programs including “Scientific Internships in Laboratories” supporting top students to undertake summer internships in labs around the world. These internships are funded (travel, stipend) under their research internship scheme. Selection is via competitive rounds (two selections). It’s targeted to students in natural sciences, technical, IT fields. The foundation also supports scholarships, English programs, and innovation projects.
majors: Biology, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Chemistry
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Amgen Scholars Program IIIT Hyderabad
description: Amgen Scholars Program at IIIT Hyderabad will enable participation of 10 undergraduate students from the Asia region in an intensive eight-week research training program with an emphasis on the application of modern Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) methods in healthcare, drug design & discovery, and fundamental sciences. Each scholar will be mentored by a faculty member and integrated into an active research lab to pursue a specific project. The program includes weekly lectures, tutorials, and hands-on sessions designed to build foundational and applied expertise in AI/ML. At the end of the program, scholars will submit a research report and present their findings through a poster or oral presentation at the Amgen Scholars Asia Symposium, an event that brings together all Amgen Scholars from all host institutions across Asia. All scholars will receive a stipend, on-campus accommodation, and travel support.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Kyoto University Amgen Scholars Program
description: The Amgen Scholars Program at Kyoto University is eight weeks of intensive research in the sciences. Amgen Scholars will be assigned to one of Kyoto University departments or interdisciplinary areas that traditionally support science and biotechnology research. These areas may include: Biochemistry / Bioengineering / Bioinformatics / Cheminformatics / Biopsychology / Biotechnology / Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering / Chemistry / Immunology / Medical Pharmacology / Microbiology / Molecular, Cell and Developmental Biology / Molecular Genetics / Molecular Medicine / Molecular Pharmacology / Neurobiology / Neuroscience / Pathology / Physiological Psychology / Physiological Science / Statistics / Toxicology
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: NUS AMGEN 2026
description: The key objective of the program is to nurture current undergraduate students who are committed and looking to further their career in biology or related sciences through graduate studies. The program features eight weeks of intensive biomedical or biotechnological research experience in basic and translational sciences. Research training and experiences are mainly provided by faculty members and research staff of the Department of Biological Sciences, who anchors the Life Sciences Program and partner Departments from the Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine at the National University of Singapore.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: The University of Tokyo
description: The objective of the program is to provide undergraduate students from different countries (including some from Japan) who are committed to or who are considering a career in biology or related sciences and looking to continue to graduate studies, with eight weeks of biomedical research experience in the basic and translational sciences.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Tsinghua Amgen Scholars
description: The Amgen Scholars Program is an international program aiming to increase research opportunities for students committed to pursuing careers in sciences. The Amgen Scholars Program at Tsinghua is an 8-week faculty-mentored residential summer research program that provides undergraduate students the opportunity to conduct research in a lab environment, engage in cutting-edge research experience, and learn more about biotechnology and drug discovery.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: ETH Zurich Amgen Scholars Program
description: ETH Zurich Amgen Scholars Program offers 10 - 12 undergraduate Bachelor students from across Europe the opportunity to take part in a summer research project in one of the laboratories at ETH.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Amgen Scholars Program at Institut Pasteur
description: Institut Pasteur is a recognized public non-profit organization with three core missions: research, public health and teaching. Founded more than a century ago and still true to the humanist ideals of Louis Pasteur, the institute of today is one of the world's leading research centers, with a multidisciplinary panel of scientific teams offering training in a large variety of topics, covering Molecular and Cellular Biology, Genetics, Immunology, Microbiology, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Structural Biology, Enzymology, Biological Chemistry, Virology, Parasitology, Mycology, Epidemiology, Imaging, Neurosciences, Developmental Biology.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Amgen Scholars Program at Karolinska Institutet
description: The Amgen Scholars Program at Karolinska Institutet (KI) is an opportunity for international and national undergraduate students to conduct research during 8 weeks in the summer at KI. The program will begin with a few days of introduction to research at KI together with lectures on scientific writing and poster presentation. The program will end with oral and poster presentations of the conducted research where the students also get trained in critiquing each other's work. Throughout the program, students will be part of a research group and participate in lab work, scientific discussions, journal clubs, seminars, and other topics. KI believes this will be an excellent way of providing a robust academic research experience to students from across Europe.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: The Amgen Scholars Programme at LMU Munich
description: Amgen Scholars at LMU Munich will engage in 9 weeks of intensive laboratory research in cooperation with the clinics, centers, departments and institutes at the LMU and its University Hopital, the Helmholtz Center, the Technical University of Munich, the Max-Planck Institutes of Biochemistry, Biological Intelligence, and Psychiatry, offering a unique academic and scientific life-science environment with renowned institutions and world-leading researchers.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Cambridge Amgen Scholars
description: The Cambridge Amgen Scholars Programme offers undergraduate students from across Europe the opportunity to take part in an eight week research project within one of the laboratories at the University of Cambridge.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: SSI – Saudi Summer Internship (KAUST)
description: The Saudi Summer Internship (SSI) is a fully sponsored 6- to 10-week research internship held at KAUST (King Abdullah University of Science and Technology) in Saudi Arabia. It offers projects in applied mathematics, computational sciences, computer science, ECE, statistics, etc. Participants attend workshops, technical training, and a final e-poster competition. The program is aimed at Saudi students, recent graduates, and master’s students. For 2026, applications open in February.
majors: Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering
eligibility: UG 3 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: RIKEN CBS Summer Program 2026
description: The RIKEN Center for Brain Science (RIKEN CBS), located just outside Tokyo, Japan, offers a summer program to train advanced students interested in brain function. Applicants may choose either a 2-month laboratory internship (Plan A) within a RIKEN CBS laboratory or an intensive 5 days lecture course (Plan B) featuring a distinguished international faculty. Those participating in the internship may also enroll in the lecture course. The course consists of an intensive 5 days lecture series featuring distinguished international faculty and poster sessions to be put on by the program participants. These two components are equally important for the students to deepen their insight and enhance their expertise in neuroscience. While the lectures serve to introduce them to cutting-edge research being carried out throughout the world, the student poster session allows them to experience the work of their colleagues and share their own research.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: Vienna BioCenter Summer School
description: 9-week Research Program or Life Science Undergrads at one of Europe's leading Research Centers
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year

name: AScI International Summer Research Programme
description: Calling all research-oriented students: Spend Summer 2026 in Finland with a transformative research assistantship at Aalto University. Open to bachelor's, master's, and—in exceptional cases—doctoral students worldwide.
majors: Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Physics
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Inria Research internships
description: Every year, Inria hosts interns in its research teams and support services (students of any level and trainee engineers). An internship at the Institute will appeal to those attracted by digital science and technology and the public research environment. Our departments can also take you if you are an apprentice, to open up new horizons for you and perhaps inspire a vocation. These two schemes offer you the chance to gain some unique experience and will open up perspectives that will help you choose the direction of your future career.
majors: Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Physics, Biomedical Engineering
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year, UG 4 year, GrM 1 year, GrM 2 year, PhD

name: Summer Student Program 2026 at HZDR
description: Each summer between July and September, the HZDR offers the possibility to join our research groups and participate in their activities. This offer applies to international senior university students of natural sciences, life sciences, medicine, technology and related areas. Our researchers design a project plan for you, supervise, and coach you throughout the whole project. A selected range of lectures and lab tours, which introduce you into the different branches of our research center, complete the program.
eligibility: UG 3 year, GrM 1 year

name: The Sanger Prize Competition 2026
description: The winner of the Sanger Institute Prize will be offered a three-month internship with a research group at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Travel, living and research expenses are all covered by the award.
eligibility: UG 1 year, UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: International Undergraduate Summer School
description: The Undergraduate Summer School is a unique opportunity for undergraduates from all corners of the world to spend eight weeks at our internationally renowned research centre, partnering with fellow Norwich Research Park institutes; The Sainsbury Laboratory and the Earlham Institute.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year

name: The Biochemical Society's Summer Vacation Studentship
description: The Biochemical Society's Summer Vacation Studentship scheme funds 6 week summer placements for undergraduate students in biochemistry and related subjects.
eligibility: UG 2 year, UG 3 year
